events.message: The customer filed a claim reporting a collision involving their car and another vehicle on the highway last night.
The claim was categorized under Auto Accident after reviewing the initial report and confirming it involved a vehicle collision.
An agent with extensive experience in auto claims was assigned to handle the customer's case promptly and professionally.
The customer received confirmation that their auto accident claim has been received and acknowledged by the insurance company.
The agent requested submission of the police report, photographs of the vehicle damage, and the driver's license for verification.
Customer submitted all requested documents including the police report and damage photos within the required timeframe.
The investigation team has started reviewing the submitted documents and contacted involved parties for further details.
Investigation concluded with confirmation that the customer was not at fault in the collision and damage estimates were verified.
The insurance company proposed a settlement amount covering all repairs and rental car costs for the customer's damaged vehicle.
The customer expressed satisfaction with the settlement proposal and appreciated the timely communication throughout the process.
Final approval was granted by the claims department, authorizing payment for the auto repair in accordance with the proposed settlement.
The payment for vehicle repairs and rental car reimbursement was issued to the customer’s account without delay.
The claim case was officially closed after all payments were confirmed and customer had no further questions or concerns.
The customer’s auto accident claim documents and case files were archived in the system for future reference as per company policy.
